Posts.Title: Stable and some shrinkage.. Fitztwins sushanna1

Posts.Content: denisela wrote: Well my sisters I went in for my six week scans and the verdict suc** . Brain mets and bone mets to the pelvis and hip. I live in Lousiana but get all my tesing done at MD Anderson in Texas so I came back home yesterday only to turn back around to Texas today and we will be here till friday again after I see Dr. his plan is for me to do testing and see Neurosurgen for consult he threw a few things at me like gamma knife & whole head radiation . The cancer seems to be in the area that affects my vision so I need to learn more about risks ect. Pray for me to get my strength renewd and faith that I can still win this battle I am not ready to give up. I need to kick some cancer A***. I just wasnt ready for this news but who is huh . Keep me in your prayers.                                                                              Hugs and Kisses,                                                                                               Denise IDC grade 3 Stage IV mets, lungs ,lymph,bones,brain Dx 2/14/2006, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/2 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2009 04:11PM denisela wrote: Cyn, I have been following your post and I am Praying for Chris and you. I have some insite as to why her Onc. said not responding after two treatments but bear with me I have terrible chemo brain and its hard to exactly quote Dr. I sought tretment at MD Anderson about two months ago they suggested Ixempra for two treatments then come back and have PET done to see if responding and I ask same thing two treatments? They explained it to me as your first two are your best bet for response and if it doesn't seem to be responding there is no reason to continue that regime. I hope that Chris can get the help she needs .I am praying for her.

Posts.Content: denisela wrote: Hello my wonderful sisters, I have returned from Houston and I definately have brain mets but not just one no that would be to easy!!! I have more than 20 I couldnt believe it when I read the report it was like a kick in the stomache. I see my Onc. tommorow at 9am to discuss treatment options I hope there are still some left. The only chemo option I have left is Doxil but I have no idea about rads for brain or what. Im really pisssed Ixempra was no cake walk and it didnt do a d*** thing. I will continue to fight but I feel really different now like somehow beacause its in the brain Im somewhat defeated, I dont know I guess Im just freaked out and rambling . Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2009 09:59PM denisela wrote: Hi I'm on Ixempra and have been on it for 3 months , Ive lost all my hair but maybe you wont. I had a PET scan done about 4 weeks ago and it showed response to treatment so Im going to continue. The biggest complaint I have is Fatigue and pain  and it bottoms out my counts after 2 rounds but I have 1 bad week out of 4 so thats really nothing to complain about. There are a few more ladies here who are on Ixempra also so I'm sure they will chat with you as well. God Bless You and I will keep you in my Prayers.     Denise

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 09:43PM denisela wrote: I deal with low platelets every week unfortunatelty there is nothing you can do no diet, exercise nothing . Your Dr. can choose to transfuse but in my case Doc. just lets mine come back up on its own. Your count is still prettty high I started having problems about my 7th cycle. Now my chemo gets delaye all the time because of my platelets being low. You need to be careful not to cut yourself when yur count it low and just rest when you can . Good Luck.
